Posts.Content: Aug 1, 2011 05:44PM Leighsa wrote: Ok, so I'm still waiting for all of this to sink in since my dx June 8th. I talk to friends and family about it, I research about it, and I read all of the incredible posts on here and yet I still have never cried. my mom says I'm stoic just like when my dh had a stroke 3 years ago at the age of 40. Maybe it's because I'm a nurse and my mind goes right to the medical side of things. I don't know. I joined a BC support group at my community hospital last week. It meets once a month. There were 6 woman there anywhere from 2-20 years post treatment and 10-40 years older then myself. I thought maybe being with them and away from my family I would be able to let my emotions out, but it didn't happen. The only way I can describe how I feel is numb.
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed and trying to keep it together Leighsa Joan811

Posts.Content: Aug 8, 2011 09:38PM Leighsa wrote: Anxiously awaiting my appointment on Thursday with the MO. Whatever treatment is needed, I say bring it on-I'm ready!
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed and trying to keep it together Leighsa Joan811

Posts.Content: Aug 11, 2011 09:07PM Leighsa wrote: Back to Mass General today for post-op visit. Everything is healing well. Oncotype test will be done and in 10-14 days I'll know if I need chemo. More waiting!
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed and trying to keep it together Leighsa Joan811

Posts.Content: Leighsa wrote: Hi. I was diagnosed in early June with Invasive Lobular CA after a 1.9 mass was found on yearly (my third ever) mammogram. After MRI, chest x-ray, advanced mammogram, and negative genetic testing- it was recommended by my team of oncologists at Mass General/Boston that I have a lumpectomy with sentinel node biopsy. I had the surgery just two weeks ago. Still very tender and experiencing strange numbness and pain in my upper arm. Path reports came back last week and the nodes were clear and the lumpectomy margins were clean. Finally path was Stage 1/grade2 ILC, ER+, PR+, HER2-. There was also evidence of some IDC. I was told before my surgery that I would need 6 weeks of radiation and Tamoxifen. Now chemo has come up as a possible treatment. I see the medical oncologist in 2weeks-on my 42 birthday to discuss treatments. Personally, I'm married and have 5 children ages 7-23 and breastfed them all for 2-10 months. i had a partial hysterectomy (uterus only) this past April for irregular periods. I was a maternal/child health nurse for 10 years and have been a middle school nurse for the past three years. My husband will tell you I'm a terrible patient! I am constantly researching information about BC. People around me are upset and concerned and I keep telling them I'm fine-which is a total lie. I feel like even though I know there is a big storm in my forecast, I just can't bring myself to take out the umbrella. That is my journey thus far. Any advice would be much appreciated. You are all so brave and inspiring! Lump and SNB on July 13th. Oncatype DX 15. Starting 28 RADS plus5 boosts on Aug 30. Dx 6/8/2011, ILC, 1cm, Stage I, Grade 2, 0/2 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed and trying to keep it together Leighsa Joan811

Posts.Content: Aug 15, 2011 08:27PM Leighsa wrote: My MO said the oncotype results are in three groups: Low risk 0-17 - chemo not usually recommended Intermediate risk 18-26 - weigh the risks vs benefits of chemo High risk above 26 - requires chemo Got a call from the lab today to let me know my sample was received last Friday and to make sure I wanted the test. Was told my insurance covers the test 100%. Results should be available next Monday. I told my MO if I needed chemo, I wanted to start ASAP because I go back to work (school nurse) the day afte Labor Day. He checked my veins and I don't need a port if I will be getting the 4 treatments over 12weeks. He said I could do chemo training in the morning and then have my first treatment that afternoon. For those that have started, is doing all that in one day doable? Hoping for low number, but want to be prepared. (((Hugs)))
Posts.Title: August 2011 chemo, anyone w/ me?! vtellen MizMarie

Posts.Content: Jul 30, 2011 09:52PM Leighsa wrote: I had my lumpectomy and SNB (left side) on July 13th and I'm still quite sore. The incisions themselves don't bother me at all, but areas to the left of each incision do. I also have a lot of discomfort along the ribs right were a bra hits. I have small dense breasts and the mass and therefore incision was below the nipple. The breast itself is still swollen (fullest it's been in years after BFing 5 kids) and the nipple is inverted a lot more then before the surgery. I also have the numbness in the back of my arm and axillary area- nervous to shave! The back of the arm also feels painful if it's touched, like TSB1, it feels sunburned. Another strange sensation I have is when I drink something cold. It feels like the ice cold fluid is filling my breast-it is so cold! It goes away after a few sips. I realize that nerves were cut and are regenerating, but it's such a weird sensation. Anyone else experience this?
Posts.Title: August 2011 chemo, anyone w/ me?! vtellen MizMarie

Posts.Content: Jul 30, 2011 09:55PM Leighsa wrote: I also get sharp/burning shooting sensations randomly that take breath away and make me cup my breast.

Posts.Content: Aug 5, 2011 03:17PM Leighsa wrote: Hello ladies! Was away for a couple of days with my 3 youngest-trying to cram in as much fun as we can! Eileen, Ellen, Kasi and Mary- congrats on getting through round 1. Reading your posts is very helpful. Thank you taking the time to post so quickly after. I hope that the SE are manageable with your meeds- Zofran is a wonderful drug! Stool softeners (colace 100mg 2-3x's /day), fresh fruit and lots of fluids should help with the constipation issues. Being backed up will only make the nausea worse. It's such a terrible cycle-take this med for this and this one for the side effects of that one, etc...! Have a great weekend-do something fun! (((Hugs)))
Posts.Title: August 2011 chemo, anyone w/ me?! vtellen MizMarie

Posts.Content: Aug 8, 2011 08:36PM Leighsa wrote: Koalakid39- sorry you are joining us, but I am with you on the "extra boost"! I am still waiting to get the final word on Thursday. Thanks to this thread, I'm ready-bring it on!! I am Irish decent-Cork (sp) County on my Dad's side. Ireland is my dream vacation! My dh (all Irish) has never had any desire to go until the SO fellow from Ireland met with us. I told her I always wanted to go and he said, "ok, we'll go". You better believe I'm holding him to it, lol! Had a great time at the Maroon 5 and Train concert last night. I got pulled up on stage and got to be a "Trainette" and dance and sing back-up to "She's on Fire". It was the highlight of my summer and I SO needed!! Michelle-thanks for sharing your experience. Wishing you minimal SE's!! Doodlebug-best wishes for tomorrow-stay strong!! (((Hugs)))

Posts.Content: Aug 15, 2011 03:38PM - edited Aug 15, 2011 03:45PM by Leighsa The oncotype test uses tissue sample from the tumor. The test is sent out for testing to a lab and is very expensive. Not all insurances will cover it. My MO said that if the test was not available, It would be recommended that I receive chemo based on my age (42) and the size of my mass (1.9cm). I'm waiting for my oncotype results-should be beginning of next week.

Posts.Content: Aug 7, 2011 12:59PM Leighsa wrote: Hello ladies! Welcome to the newbies! I hope those of you that started last week are feeling better each day-you rock! To those starting this week-you can do, we all can!! I agree that we have every right to complain! I still get pain from my lump and SNB and tried telling my younger sister about it. She said, "that's nothing, when I had my breasts done...". I was thinking, is she seriously comparing my breast CA to her boob job!!! She also thinks she knows more then me about BC because her friends have friends/family members that went through it. It took everything to bite my tongue. Laughing yoga sounds interesting,but like madismommy, my chest hurts still when I laugh. Looking forward to Date Night with my dh tonight. Going to see Train & Maroon 5 - FRONT ROW! (((Hugs)))
